explanation: The bug was in the assumption that the input would always have exactly three elements. If the user inputs fewer than three elements, it will cause an IndexError. To fix this, I added a conversion to ensure the loop iterates over a dynamic length based on the input lists. I replaced 'for i in range(3):' with 'for i in range(min(len(S), len(T))):' to avoid accessing out of bounds of either list.
